content:
(ii) is indemnified in not more than one annual period of original insurance.
   
   For the purpose of this clause, "pollutants" means any solid liquid gaseous or thermal irritant or contaminant, including but not limited to smoke vapour soot fumes acid alkalis chemicals and waste. Waste includes material to be recycled reconditioned or reclaimed.
7. Any accident, loss, damage, death, injury or liability directly or indirectly caused by or contributed to or arising from:
   (a) ionizing radiation or contamination by radioactivity from any nuclear fuel, material or waste from the combustion of nuclear fuel including any self-sustaining process of nuclear fission; or
   (b) any nuclear weapons material.
questions: What does the term 'pollutants' encompass in the insurance clause?
How many times can one be indemnified within a single annual period according to the insurance policy?
What are some examples of contaminants mentioned in the insurance clause?
What types of accidents or damages are not covered by the insurance due to nuclear activities?
What does 'waste' refer to in the context of the insurance policy?
Can an individual claim insurance for damages caused by nuclear weapons material?
Is damage from ionizing radiation covered by this insurance policy?
What substances are considered as 'chemicals' under the pollutants definition in the insurance clause?
Are there any exclusions in the insurance policy related to nuclear fission?
Does the insurance cover liabilities arising from the contamination by radioactivity?
